snippet: In 1927, Georges Lemaître, an astronomer from Belgium, first proposed the theory that the universe was born in a giant primeval explosion. Four years later, The New York Times mentioned his new idea.
abstract: New York Times first mentioned idea akin to Big Bang Theory in May 19, 1931 article, and actual phrase 'big bang' in December 31, 1956 article; theory, now almost universally accepted among astronomers, was initially greeted with derision.
lead_paragraph: In 1927, Georges Lemaître, an astronomer from Belgium, first proposed the theory that the universe was born in a giant primeval explosion. Four years later, The New York Times mentioned his new idea.

headline.main: Ripples of the Big Bang Are Seen Through ‘The Times’
